CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1954, pg. 21, reads: "Jackie Robinson - Bats for Brotherhood - Jackie Robinson, 1954 chairman of the Commission on Community Organizations of the National Conference of Christians and Jews, is undertaking a nation-wide tour building interest in Brotherhood Week, to be celebrated Feb. 21-28. He was in Pittsburgh Monday.  Other stops include Detroit, South Bend, St. Louis, Tulsa and Los Angeles.  Louis A. Radelat, director of the commission, accompanied Jackie. Telecast - A telecast with sportscaster Ray Scott, aboe, was one of the highlights as Jackie worked for brotherhood as hard as he plays baseball.... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Brooklyn Dodgers baseball player Jackie Robinson being interviewed by sportswriter Ray Scott, in interior with advertisement for Raytheon TV and sports photographs on back wall
